emerging_technologies.name: AI-Driven Code Synthesis
emerging_technologies.description: AI systems capable of generating entire software applications from high-level descriptions or user requirements.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Reduces the barrier to entry for software development, potentially leading to an oversaturation of software, raising issues of quality control and job displacement in coding professions.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: High initial cost, need for AI model training, ethical concerns regarding automation of creative work.

emerging_technologies.name: Neuralink 2.0
emerging_technologies.description: An advanced brain-computer interface that allows for bidirectional communication between the brain and digital devices, enhancing cognitive abilities.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Raises ethical questions about privacy, consent, and the potential for cognitive enhancement disparities.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Regulatory approval, public acceptance of invasive technology, advancements in neuroscience.

emerging_technologies.name: Quantum-Resistant Blockchain
emerging_technologies.description: A blockchain technology designed to withstand attacks from quantum computers, ensuring long-term security for digital assets.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Critical for maintaining trust in digital transactions as quantum computing advances.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Need for widespread understanding of quantum computing risks, integration into existing systems, standardization efforts.

emerging_technologies.name: Autonomous Urban Mobility Hubs
emerging_technologies.description: Fully automated hubs where various forms of autonomous transportation (cars, drones, bikes) can be managed, recharged, and maintained.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Reduces urban congestion, improves air quality, but requires significant infrastructure changes and public acceptance.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Infrastructure investment, urban planning integration, regulatory frameworks for autonomous vehicles.

mainstream_technologies.name: AI Pair Programming
mainstream_technologies.description: AI tools that work alongside human developers in real-time, suggesting code, debugging, and optimizing software development processes.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Widely adopted in software development teams, with significant improvements in productivity and code quality.

mainstream_technologies.name: Blockchain for Supply Chain
mainstream_technologies.description: Blockchain technology used to track and verify the authenticity and journey of products from manufacturer to consumer.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Mainstream in high-value goods sectors like pharmaceuticals and luxury items, with increasing adoption in other sectors due to transparency benefits.

epoch_themes.description: A growing integration of AI into daily human activities, enhancing both productivity and personal capabilities.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Shift in job markets, new ethical considerations around AI decision-making, and potential for increased social inequality.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Acceleration of AI integration across industries, focus on ethical AI, and international cooperation for AI governance.

epoch_themes.description: Innovations aimed at making urban environments more sustainable, efficient, and livable.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Improvement in quality of life, reduction in carbon footprint, but potential challenges in infrastructure overhaul and socio-economic displacement.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Global push towards smart cities, urban renewal projects focusing on sustainability, and integration of green technologies.
